name: Schema Discriminator 1
title: Schema Discriminator 1: BileDuctsDistal/BileDuctsPerihilar/CysticDuct
notes:
**Note:** A schema discriminator is used to discriminate for primary site C240 (extrahepatic bile ducts) for the subsite in which the tumor arose.

* **Chapter 24: Gallbladder (see code 3)**
Per AJCC 8th edition, the gallbladder tapers into the cystic duct

* **Chapter 25: Perihilar Bile Ducts (see codes 1, 5, 6, 9)**
Per AJCC 8th edition, perihilar (or proximal) cholangiocarcinomas involve the main biliary confluence of the right and left hepatic ducts and comprise 50-70% of all cases of bile ducts carcinomas

* **Chapter 26: Distal Bile Ducts ( see codes 4, 7)**
Per AJCC 8th edition, these tumors have their center located between the confluence of the cystic duct and common hepatic duct and the Ampulla of Vater (excluding ampullary carcinomas.)
rows:
Perihilar bile duct(s)
Proximal extrahepatic bile duct(s)
Hepatic duct(s)

Distal bile duct
Common bile duct
Common duct, NOS

Diffuse involvement 
More than one subsite involved, subsite of origin not stated

Stated as middle extrahepatic bile duct
AND treated with combined hepatic and hilar resection

Stated as middle extrahepatic bile duct
AND treated with pancreaticoduodenectomy
